citation.article-title: Aciditerrimonas ferrireducens gen. nov., sp. nov., an iron-reducing thermoacidophilic actinobacterium isolated from a solfataric field
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Aciditerrimonas (A.ci.di.ter.ri.mo′nas. L. neut. n. acidum an acid; L. n. terra soil; L. fem. n. monas a unit, monad; N.L. fem. n. Aciditerrimonas acidic soil monad).
Cells are short rods, 0.5–0.6×0.8–1.1 µm, motile with peritrichous flagella.
Thermoacidophilic, growing optimally at 50 °C and pH 3.0.
The major cellular fatty acids are iso-C16 : 0, anteiso-C17 : 0 and iso-C18 : 0.
The major quinone component is MK-9(H8).
The phospholipid composition includes phosphatidyl-N-methylethanolamine and an unknown ninhydrin-positive phosphoglycolipid.
Phylogenetically affiliated in the order Acidimicrobiales according to 16S rRNA gene sequence comparisons.
The 16S rRNA signature pattern is the same as that of the family Acidimicrobiaceae as indicated by Zhi et al. (2009), except for 952 : 1229 (U–A).
The type species is Aciditerrimonas ferrireducens.
